author: @WBTV_News
title: Warm Christmas on its way across Charlotte Metro: Latest forecast here
text:
Warm Christmas on its way across Charlotte Metro: Latest forecast here
Warming trend continuing through next week
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (WBTV) - Get ready for more sunshine and a slight warm-up over the weekend.
After a stormy start to the morning, we are going to wrap up this afternoon with gusty winds and sunshine; expect highs in the 50s. After sunset, the winds will die down, giving way to chilly temperatures in the 30s under mostly clear skies.
Pleasant and dry weather will continue into the weekend with mostly sunny skies and highs in the 50s and 60s both on Saturday and Sunday.
Looking ahead
Next week is on track to be mainly dry with a continued warming trend. Monday and Tuesday will be mostly sunny to partly cloudy with highs in the 50s.
Christmas Eve and Christmas Day will be dry and even warming with highs in the mid to upper 60s.
Forecast at a glance
- Rest of Today: Mostly sunny, gusty winds
- Weekend Outlook: Mostly sunny, warmer
- Monday: Mostly sunny, chilly
Download the free WBTV Weather app on your mobile device to receive weather alerts and get your latest WBTV weather forecast on the go. You can also get the latest weather forecast on Roku and Amazon Fireâ€™s WBTV app.
Have a good weekend!
Elissia
